@graph.name: Vegan Sweet Potato Rolls - Soft Herb Dinner Rolls
@graph.description: Vegan Sweet Potato Rolls - Soft Herb Dinner Rolls. 7 Ingredients! 1 Bowl, Almost no Knead, No added Sugar Freezer friendly. Melt in your mouth sweet potato bread rolls. Vegan Soyfree Nutfree Recipe

video.name: Vegan Sweet Potato Rolls â€“ 7 Ingr, Almost No Knead, Super Soft | Vegan Richa Recipes
video.description:
These Sweet Potato Rolls need just 7 Ingredients, 1 Bowl, are almost no knead, have No Added Sugar, and can be made without Oil! 
Full recipe - https://www.veganricha.com/2018/11/vegan-sweet-potato-rolls.html

These Super Soft dinner rolls are what fresh bread dreams are made of! There is a triple moisture action going on here. Yeast rising slowly with just a bit of flour, the sweet potato, and then another rise. All of these together allow for amazing moisture retention in the bread. And to top it all, you donâ€™t even need to knead it much! Just mix to bring everything together into a somewhat dough and everything will work out!

You can use Pumpkin puree, butternut puree or Mashed Potatoes(thin them slightly with non dairy milk for soft white dinner rolls), in these rolls. Super versatile and delicious as is. For sweeter rolls, omit the herbs and add some sugar/sweetener. These are lightly herbed and lightly savory just like regular dinner rolls.

#veganricha #easyveganrecipes #vegan #veganism #veganrecipes #cooking

recipeIngredient: 3/4 cup non dairy milk ((warmed to just about warm to touch))
3/4 cup sweet potato puree ((canned or boiled, steamed sweet potato that has been mashed/pureed well))
2 tbsp oil ((optional), see tips section for no oil)
1 to 2 tbsp dried herbsÂ  ((thyme, rosemary, chives or a combination, or 2 tbsp fresh herbs))

recipeInstructions.text: Mix the yeast and warmed non dairy milk and let sit for 5 mins
recipeInstructions.name: Mix the yeast and warmed non dairy milk and let sit for 5 mins

recipeInstructions.text: Add the sweet potato puree and 1/2 cup of flour and mix in, whisk until no lumps. Cover and let sit for at least 30 mins.
recipeInstructions.name: Add the sweet potato puree and 1/2 cup of flour and mix in, whisk until no lumps. Cover and let sit for at least 30 mins.

recipeInstructions.text: Add oil, 2 cups of flour*, salt and herbs. Lightly mix the salt and herbs into the flour before mixing into the wet. (Start with 1.5 cups if your sweet potato puree/mash is less moist or if using more whole grain flours)
recipeInstructions.name: Add oil, 2 cups of flour*, salt and herbs. Lightly mix the salt and herbs into the flour before mixing into the wet. (Start with 1.5 cups if your sweet potato puree/mash is less moist or if using more whole grain flours)

recipeInstructions.text: Add flour 1/4 cup at a time and make a lightly sticky dough. If you you work it too much with your hands it will get stickier. You just want a cohesive lightly sticky state.
recipeInstructions.name: Add flour 1/4 cup at a time and make a lightly sticky dough. If you you work it too much with your hands it will get stickier. You just want a cohesive lightly sticky state.

recipeInstructions.text: Cover and let rise until doubled in size, 45 mins or longer. (You can shape the dough into rolls after 15 mins of rising and freeze them to bake later. To bake, let the frozen rolls thaw and rise in a warm oven (about 3 hours). Bake once they have risen to about double)
recipeInstructions.name: Cover and let rise until doubled in size, 45 mins or longer. (You can shape the dough into rolls after 15 mins of rising and freeze them to bake later. To bake, let the frozen rolls thaw and rise in a warm oven (about 3 hours). Bake once they have risen to about double)

recipeInstructions.text: Divide the dough into 8 or 10 equal parts. shape into rolls, by rolling between your hands and pulling on the sides (see video). Place in a greased/parchment lined stoneware pan or cast iron skillet.
recipeInstructions.name: Divide the dough into 8 or 10 equal parts. shape into rolls, by rolling between your hands and pulling on the sides (see video). Place in a greased/parchment lined stoneware pan or cast iron skillet.

recipeInstructions.text: Brush the tops with oil, then let rise for 20-25 mins until almost doubled. Meanwhile preheat the oven to 385 degrees F (200 C).
recipeInstructions.name: Brush the tops with oil, then let rise for 20-25 mins until almost doubled. Meanwhile preheat the oven to 385 degrees F (200 C).

recipeInstructions.text: Bake at 385 deg F for 21-22 min. Remove from the oven and Brush with vegan butter or oil and serve. (You can also freeze baked rolls. Cool completely, wrap in foil and freeze. To reheat, thaw for a few hours, then bake at 300 F for 10-12 mins).To make these into sweet rolls. Omit the herbs, use 3/4 tsp salt, add 4 tbsp sugar or sweetener with the sweet potato puree. Add 1 tsp spices like cinnamon or pumpkin pie spice.
recipeInstructions.name: Bake at 385 deg F for 21-22 min. Remove from the oven and Brush with vegan butter or oil and serve. (You can also freeze baked rolls. Cool completely, wrap in foil and freeze. To reheat, thaw for a few hours, then bake at 300 F for 10-12 mins).To make these into sweet rolls. Omit the herbs, use 3/4 tsp salt, add 4 tbsp sugar or sweetener with the sweet potato puree. Add 1 tsp spices like cinnamon or pumpkin pie spice.
